militarytimes.com  (WEB - en-US)

The Military Times website, which publishes news for current and former U.S. military members and their families. MilitaryTimes.com shares a newsroom with four other news organizations focused on the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marines.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

MilitaryTimes.com is published by Sightline Media Group. Sightline owns a handful of other government and security-related media organizations, including Defense News, which covers the policy and business of military defense. Sightline is owned by a California private equity firm, Regent L.P., which also owns the hair salon chain Supercuts and the gifts and home goods retailer Lillian Vernon.

Regent L.P. bought Sightline from Tegna Inc., a spinoff of newspaper publisher Gannett, in March 2016. MilitaryTimes.com generates revenue through advertisements and clearly labeled sponsored content.

Content

On its About Us page, Military Times describes itself as a “trusted, independent source for news and information” for members of the U.S. military and their family. The site adds that it is a “one-stop online source for breaking news; personal finance information; healthcare; recreational resources; exclusive videos and photos; Guard and Reserve information; and an expanded community area connecting service members, military families, and veterans.”

It has special sections for issues affecting military spouses and family members, transitioning soldiers to daily life after service ends, details on veterans’ benefits, and other resources such as an interactive map of military installations nationwide.

Stories on MilitaryTimes.com are produced by journalists from a common newsroom that the site shares shares with four others: ArmyTimes.com, NavyTimes.com, MarineCorpsTimes.com and AirForceTimes.com. Stories often appear on multiple sites. MilitaryTimes.com publishes articles on a wide range of topics including military-related congressional activity and trends with defense equipment, while also reporting on military culture. Other stories are geared toward military families, with topics such as Defense Department schools and spousal-support programs.

The site also publishes stories from The Associated Press.

Credibility

The news organization, based in suburban northern Virginia, maintains bureaus at the Pentagon and on Capitol Hill. A staff directory posted on MilitaryTimes.com names more than two dozen reporters, editors, producers, and bureau chiefs who work for the common Military Times newsroom. Reporters for Military Times and its associated sites often conduct original reporting to produce stories. Other stories aggregate information from other news outlets, including newspapers, TV news stations, and wire services.

MilitaryTimes.com publishes correction notices on its articles when they have errors.

Transparency

The Military Times website discloses that Regent L.P. owns Sightline, the site’s publisher.

MilitaryTimes.com publishes a list of its editors and reporters along with their email addresses. Readers can also click on bylines for writers’ contact and biographical information. The organization’s leadership is also listed on the site.

History

Military Times began as the Army Times newspaper in 1940. Army Times continues to be printed on a biweekly basis, as do Navy Times, Marine Corps Times, and Air Force Times. The Military Times does not have a print edition.
